column4: hi I'm trying to create a bootable USB drive, I'm having trouble. I use dd to copy an image onto a UDB disk, the command was dd if=disk.img of=/dev/sdb1  Should I have used /dev/sdb instead?
no, the command looks all right. Were you following a guide?
yes I'm getting an error PXE... which is a network card issue? So I think my usb device isn't getting detected
yes, it's either not even trying to boot from USB (which you should fix via BIOS setup), or there is no suitable boot sector. Some hardware won't boot off USB at all.
did you partition and format the USB device before you used the dd?
the bios lists USB HDD as  first to boot. So maybe it's the image? I didn't format the USB, just using dd so I thought it was unnecessary
In gparted, it lists the card as fat and bootable
did you dd *from* a fat filesystem as well?
well, this OS is ext, the dd image is fat (at least I think it is)
gparted lists the usb as fat16, and on it I see various files, so it looks  like it is not corrupted
I think you should have a look at the install page -- it links to instructions for USB HD installations. Private message...
also gparted reports that it is flagged as bootable
I'm using irssi (text based irc) not sure if I have private messages,, I'll go check the offical site and see if I missed a step
the bootable flag doesn't matter these days -- well, only to DOS MBRs. Which makes me think: did you install grub to the device?
if not, the installation link ^^ will guide you
the computer currently has gOS installed, and grub is installed
thanks for your help
you need grub on the USB HD as well
ahh,, that might be it
any way to tell? I can see some files on it
if you didn't consciously put it in the MBR, it won't be there. Use the link ^^
I think that's it then thanks
